snippet: A former Brooklyn police commander recounted efforts by District Attorney Charles J. Hynes to avert a rabbi’s arrest and prosecution.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column criticizes Brooklyn District Attorney Charles J Hynes's handling of sex abuse cases in the ultra-Orthodox community, suggesting that he is unduly influenced by the political clout that rabbis wield; cites 1994 incident in which New York City Police division commander William Plackenmeyer arrested ultra-Orthodox Rabbi Shlomo Helbrans, who was accused of kidnapping 13-year-old Shai Fhima Reuven, only to meet with refusal of the district attorney to press charges.
lead_paragraph: A former Brooklyn police commander recounted efforts by District Attorney Charles J. Hynes to avert a rabbi’s arrest and prosecution.

headline.seo: Charles Hynes Appeared to Block 1994 Kidnapping Case
headline.main: Police vs. Prosecutor in ’94 Brooklyn Kidnapping Case Against a Rabbi
headline.print_headline: Police vs. Prosecutor in ’94 Brooklyn Kidnapping Case Against Rabbi
